name: Tembleque Choco-Coco
author: Anonymous
summary: Layers of chocolate and coconut custard make up this variation of a traditional Puerto Rican dessert.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups SPLENDA® No Calorie Sweetener, Granulated
6 cinnamon sticks cinnamon sticks, plus additional for garnish
⅓ cup SPLENDA® No Calorie Sweetener, Granulated
directions: Combine the coconut milk, salt, 11/2 cups of SPLENDA® Granulated Sweetener, vanilla, and cinnamon sticks in a 4-6 quart pan and simmer for 10 minutes
Combine cornstarch and 1 cup water in a small mixing bowl, stirring until dissolved
Add the cornstarch mixture to the simmering coconut milk
Stir until well combined and a creamy consistency is reached
of unsweetened chocolate and the remaining 1/3 cup SPLENDA® Granulated Sweetener to one half, mixing until well combined
Pour or spoon the two mixtures into dessert glasses, alternating white and chocolate layers
Toast 3 oz of shredded coconut on a baking sheet in a 400 degree F oven for 6 - 10 minutes until brown or in non-stick pan over medium heat until done
Garnish with a dollop of chocolate
Add mint leaves, raspberries and cinnamon stick
